alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:57PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Symmes Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1252 PM EST, The automated gauge on Symmes Creek at Aid indicated the creek was cresting just shy of 20 feet. The creek will slowly fall to within its banks late this afternoon. At stages of 19 feet, fields and low areas along Symmes Creek flood. Sections of State Route 378 begin to flood in the Linnville area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waterloo and Aid. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
